passage_text: Airbus military programmes. Airbus is an aircraft manufacturing subsidiary of a European aerospace company called EADS and is based in Toulouse, France next to Toulouse-Blagnac Airport (2009) . Airbus is one of the leading manufacturers of aircraft in the world and supplies about half of all the world’s jet airliners. Their mission is to “provide the aircraft best suited to the markets needs and to support these aircraft with the highest quality of service” (2009) . Although Airbus’ headquarters are in France, they also have subsidiaries in North America, China and Japan.

The planes manufactured by them are known as Airbus Aircraft. There are many versions of Airbus Aircraft. Airbus A380 aircraft is 4 Engine Aircraft with twin aisle and double deck having seating capacity from 555 to 853 passengers, It was launched in 2002. Delivery of first aircraft is expected in Summer 2007. Airbus Industries is the company that produces Airbus planes, a competitor of Boeing. Airbus A380 will be the greatest passenger plane, being able to carry up to 800 passengers. Will be released in 2007 cause they can figure out something... to make it completely operable. Paolo · 9 years ago.

Airbus employs around 63,000 people at sixteen sites in four countries: France, Germany, Spain and the United Kingdom. Final assembly production is based at Toulouse, France; Hamburg, Germany; Seville, Spain; and, since 2009 as a joint-venture, Tianjin, China. In mid-1988 a group of Airbus engineers led by Jean Roeder began working in secret on the development of an ultra-high-capacity airliner (UHCA), both to complete its own range of products and to break the dominance that Boeing had enjoyed in this market segment since the early 1970s with its 747.

Airbus S.A.S. is a leading aircraft manufacturer based in Toulouse, France. The company is a fully-owned subsidiary of EADS N.V., a pan-European aerospace concern. Airbus Industries is the company that produces Airbus planes, a competitor of Boeing. Airbus A380 will be the greatest passenger plane, being able to carry up to 800 passengers. Will be released in 2007 cause they can figure out something... to make it completely operable. Paolo · 9 years ago.

Airbus began as a consortium of aerospace manufacturers, Airbus Industrie. Consolidation of European defence and aerospace companies in 1999 and 2000 allowed the establishment of a simplified joint-stock company in 2001, owned by EADS (80%) and BAE Systems (20%). In mid-1988 a group of Airbus engineers led by Jean Roeder began working in secret on the development of an ultra-high-capacity airliner (UHCA), both to complete its own range of products and to break the dominance that Boeing had enjoyed in this market segment since the early 1970s with its 747.

A jet aircraft (or simply jet) is an aircraft (nearly always a fixed-wing aircraft) propelled by jet engines (jet propulsion). Rocket-powered jet aircraft were pioneered in Germany. The first aircraft to fly under rocket power was the Lippisch Ente, in 1928. The Ente had previously been flown as a glider. The next year, in 1929, the Opel RAK.1 became the first purpose-built rocket plane to fly.

The Airbus A380 is a double-deck, wide-body, four-engine jet airliner manufactured by the European aircraft company Airbus. It is the world's largest passenger airliner, and the airports at which it operates have upgraded facilities to accommodate it. The aircraft configuration was finalised in early 2001, and manufacturing of the first A380 wing box component started on 23 January 2002. The development cost of the A380 had grown to €11-14 billion when the first aircraft was completed.

As of September 2015, Airbus had received 317 firm orders and delivered 171 aircraft; Emirates is the biggest A380 customer with 140 on order and 67 delivered. The aircraft configuration was finalised in early 2001, and manufacturing of the first A380 wing box component started on 23 January 2002. The development cost of the A380 had grown to €11-14 billion when the first aircraft was completed.

[ˈerβus]) is a division of Airbus Group SE that manufactures civil aircraft. It is based in Blagnac, France, a suburb of Toulouse, with production and manufacturing facilities mainly in France, Germany, Spain and the United Kingdom. In mid-1988 a group of Airbus engineers led by Jean Roeder began working in secret on the development of an ultra-high-capacity airliner (UHCA), both to complete its own range of products and to break the dominance that Boeing had enjoyed in this market segment since the early 1970s with its 747.

What is Airbus? Airbus is an aircraft manufacturing subsidiary of a European aerospace company called EADS and is based in Toulouse, France next to Toulouse-Blagnac Airport (2009) . Airbus is one of the leading manufacturers of aircraft in the world and supplies about half of all the world’s jet airliners. Their mission is to “provide the aircraft best suited to the markets needs and to support these aircraft with the highest quality of service” (2009) . Although Airbus’ headquarters are in France, they also have subsidiaries in North America, China and Japan.
